lines.text: When the day of quality ends in this country, we'll all be in great trouble indeed.

[after watching his younger self make a deal with Jack Latham]
Yup, that's me! I always moved in when the moment was good. I could always smell a good business deal.
So could Latham. Look where he ended up.
I know this place. I've never been here before. Why does it look so familiar?
On my office wall. My... employee... over his desk...
He deserved to be fired. Disagrees with everything I do. Conspires with others to pull money out of me. Who needs someone like that around?
There are three in here who do.

[seeing an overgrown gravesite]
Wait, wait. There is something about this place. Something draws me right to it. The monument looks fairly new, and yet, neglected.
To lie in a grave, un-loved and un-remembered, is as if the life was never lived.
That is the only... real death.
If? That word can be found on dry river beds and trails overgrown by weeds. What's more important are the paths we follow now...
